answers.answer: Just try and relax. Don't put more stress on you or baby by being nervous. I personally have not yet had bp issue a but I'm sure its scary. Your doctor should of talkies to you about how to maintain it..

Have you had high bp during this pregnancy at all?  How far are you? I suffer with high bp with all my pregnancies. I was induced with my 1st as a result. Just try and remain as calm as you can. Hard I know. Best of luck x
I'm 29weeks 6 days this was the first time I had high blood pressure this pregnancy

I too understand how you feel. Calming down is so much easier said than done, but it's a choice that we have to make for our little ones. I went to the doctor and they said that my blood pressure was high.  My blood pressure has been normal my whole pregnancy. I just turned 31 weeks and they think  I may have preclampsia. I've been tested for preclampsia and I do not have it but my baby is not growing so more than likely they say preclampsia will show her head  around 3 weeks from now. I am now on bed rest and I've only had one high reading for high blood pressure my entire pregnancy. I do know how you feel , so stay calm and best of luck to you and your baby... this too shall pass.
We'll after hours of waiting frantically all bloodwork came back negitive and they sent me home

question: Was at my dr appr and had high blood pressure so now I'm in triage they are thinking I may have preeclampsia I'm scared and nervous trying to calm down but it's not happening this has never happened in my other pregnancies I know they are all different
title: Nervous
